low English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 121 in today's
episode I have a new idiom for you to
steer clear off let's find out what it
means and how you can use it in your
daily conversation to steer clear off
there are certain people or things that
you keep away from the idiom to steer
clear off basically means to avoid
someone or something as they may cause
trouble or danger if you steer clear of
something you keep a safe distance from
a particular thing because you do not
like it or you find that thing or person
dangerous so if you find someone or
something unpleasant or likely of
creating trouble it is best to steer
clear of them and have nothing to do
with them for example if you break into
frequent arguments with your colleague
it is better to talk to him only if
required it means it is wiser to steer
clear of him as extra conversation may
break out into an argument which creates
unpleasantness okay now that you know
what this idiom means let's take a look
at some example sentences to see how to
use it in your daily conversation
example 1 at a very young age richer is
completely addicted to smoking and can't
steer clear of it
example two during an argument
Melissa angrily told her colleague to
steer clear of her way and mind his own
business example three to stay young and
healthy
Veronica steers clear of junk food
example 4 due to his injury the doctor
has advised Walter to steer clear of
playing tennis for a few weeks
example 5 one must steer clear of using
hair dryers as they cause excess damage
to the hair example 6 though she has
been dating Victor for a few months Lara
steers clear of any deep emotional
involvement example 7 after her divorce
Sandra has been so depressed that she
stays indoors and steers clear of
meeting people example 8 Veronica steers
clear of her math class and spends her
time reading at the library example 9 to
steer clear of unwanted calls Henry
keeps the receiver off the hook
that's the end of today's episode what
do you steer clear off and why kindly
